240R/A0/08/001/004.status_value: Update. Through specific field missions  support was given to small town  urban water supply programs in Kenya  Somalia and Ethiopia. Namibia and Angola was supported to develop WASH response plans for drought.  Ongoing review process of sustainability of water supply programs in Netherlands funded countries  via sustainability checks.
240R/A0/08/001/004.indicator_name: # of countries supported to implement sustainable community water supply

240R/A0/08/001/004.status_value: Update. 14 were directly supported to monitor e-Thekwini commitments in the run-up to the Eastern and Southern Africa sub-regional preparatory meetings ¿ UNICEF led the review process in each of the countries  with support from RO.  Regional Office will support these countries directly and support planning of the meeting in Zambia. RO attended the rollout workshop for the WASH Bottleneck Analysis tool and will support country application in at least two countries in ESAR.
240R/A0/08/001/004.indicator_name: # of countries supported in monitoring equity and sustainability strategies (Netherlands  SRAs  JMP  Ethekwini etc.)

240R/A0/08/001/004.status_value: Update: A discussion note and technical brief on urban WASH developed that review urban activities in 11/21 country offices in the region. Urban WASH WebEx held with participation 13 countries. Country WASH fact sheets were developed for all countries in the Region and a regional factsheet was produced. A WASH in Schools publication produced and to be disseminated providing a consolidated situational analysis  gaps/challenges of WinS programmes and recommendations. A training module on self supp
240R/A0/08/001/004.indicator_name: Good practice publications reflecting country case studies.

240R/A0/08/001/004.status_value: Update: A thorough analysis of the six RESU high priority countries was carried out to support the overall ESARO analysis of country preparedness. A similar analysis of eight other countries was carried out  in preparation for advise to the COs on preparedness and planning in the second half of the year. As updates are flagged by the system  updated comments are provided to WASH emergency focal points in COs as well as to RESU. Advice was also provided to RESU on an overhaul of the system
240R/A0/08/001/004.indicator_name: # of high risk COs with WASH components of EW-EA supported for a minimum standard

240R/A0/08/001/004.status_value: Update: A regional overview on ODF protocol and strategies developed to support regional EOD programs. Support provided to development of new EOD programs in Namibia  South Sudan  Somalia. Support provided to large scale programs in Zambia  Zimbabwe and Malawi. Development of a new regional proposal for sanitation and hygiene for submission to Government of the Netherlands

240R/A0/08/001/005.status_value: Following the Federal Govt. of Ethiopia's hosting of the African Leadership for Child Survival Forum  three additional countries ¿ Zambia  Uganda  and Malawi ¿ with support from HQ and RO  and led by national Govts  mobilized and convened national stakeholders around a data-driven diagnostic of the causes of preventable mortality  the bottlenecks and underlying drivers  and crafted sharpened strategies and plans with benchmarks ¿ all of them with a strong focus on MNH. Kenya with support from HQ

240R/A0/08/001/005.status_value: During 2013 a series of events contributed to heightened visibility of the significant implementation and quality gaps with regards MNH programming. The region hosted three international conferences on Maternal Health  Newborn Health  and the AU's International Conference on MNCH  and several Regional initiatives on MNH (e.g. Regional MNH Forum Co-convened by USAID/REDSO  EAC'd Open Health Initiative). Several of these also hosted stakeholder consultations on the global Every Newborn Action Plan

240R/A0/09/002/007.indicator_name: Number of countries in which 50% of adolescents 15-19 who were tested for HIV and received their results in the last 12 months
240R/A0/09/002/007.headline: The HIV team provided quality and timely technical assistance to 16 priority countries on first decade and second decade programming and HIV in emergencies. The Regional Network Meeting for HIV focal points resulted in common vision and more strategic approaches to HIV programming in the region.

240R/A0/09/800/001.indicator_name: % Counselling requests responded to within 12 hours
240R/A0/09/800/001.headline: The 2018-2021 Regional Office Management Plan and updated Regional Priorities were completed  following RMT in February 2017. Staff counselling-services were delivered by responding within 6-12 hours while Security successfully conducted the Women Security Awareness Training for 11 Country-Offices. Rwanda-CO will be relocated to a safer premises  meeting the UNMOSS requirements.

240R/A0/09/800/002.indicator_name: 'Number of COs TRP/PBR submissions reviewed including percentage of COs in adherence to submission requirements (per year)

Preparedness for the Botswana  Namibia  Lesotho  Swaziland (BNLS) Operations Hub implementation.
